_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A.  Describe the Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies



It is the intent of Farmland Foods to provide a safe work environment for every employee, and to protect them from injury and illness resulting from unsafe acts or conditions during hours of employment.  Farmland will also comply with all Federal, State, and local laws.  The General Manager has the responsibility for leadership of the safety and health program, for its effectiveness and improvement, and for providing the safeguards required to ensure safe conditions.



Ammonia safety programs are key items in the plant safety and health program.  Farmland Foods takes many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions such as pressure increase that could cause a system failure, a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the ongoing integrity of the systems, a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel, and emergency response procedures which enable trained personnel to respond quickly to system upsets.



The facility Environmental Manager is responsible for the overall management of the IRM-PSM ammonia safety programs.





B.  Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled



Farmland Foods produces pork products for sale to the public.  The facility operates an ammonia refrigeration system to cool or freeze the food products and production areas.  Ammonia is the only regulated substance handled at the Crete, NE facility. 





C.  Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program



The Farmland Foods AA? Crete, NE facility has a program level 3 accidental release prevention program for the ammonia system that complies with OSHAAA?s Process Safety Management Standard and EPAAA?s Risk Management Program Regulation.  The ammonia prevention program consist

s of the following elements:



AA?Employee Participation Program

AA?Process Safety Information

AA?Process Hazard Analysis

AA?Operating Procedures

AA?Training Program

AA?Contractor Safety Program

AA?Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

AA?Mechanical Integrity Program

AA?Hot Work Permit Procedures

AA?Management of Change Procedures

AA?Incident Investigation Procedures

AA?Emergency Planning and Response Procedures

AA?Compliance Audit Procedures



 

D.  Five-Year Accident History



There have not been any ammonia-related incidents at the Farmland Foods AA? Crete, NE facility during the previous five years that resulted in significant on-site or off-site consequences.





E.  Description of Emergency Response Program



An emergency response program has been implemented at the Farmland Foods AA? Crete, NE facility.  This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to fires, ammonia leaks and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures.



The emergency response program includes the following elements:



AA?Fire Plan

AA?Ammonia Leak Procedures

AA?Evacuation Procedures





F.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Changes were recommended to improve the equipment and the system operating procedures when the ammonia refrigeration system underwent a third party mechanical integrity audit May 2006 through November 2006.  The recommended changes have been evaluated and are being implemented as required.
